answers.answer: HiHigh eosinophil count is seen in autoimmune problems like Hashimotos’s thyroiditis. Other problems like asthma, eczema etc too show a high eosinophil count. Low monocytes are taken as a marker of state oh health, which is not perfect. They are low in aplastic anemaia. Marginally low values are expected with chronic health problems.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted.

Thank you very much for the help.  I brought it up to my primary yesterday when I was being seen for a bad infection on my toe that just won't heal properly.  He didn't seem to have much of a response to it.  However he did add yet another medication to my list besides the antibiotic for the toe... Listrol or something like that for High Blood pressure.  155/95 is where I have been for a few months to a year.  I feel like I'm about to turn 80 not 30. :-P

HiDo you or anybody in your family related to you by blood have a history of diabetes? If yes, please get the blood sugar test done. Do not worry about your CBC. It is expected with your history. Non-Healing wound or infection can be due to diabetes or due to thyroid problems too.Take care and do keep me posted.

Hello, Thanks for asking... I actually do have diabetes.  Type 2 and only diagnosed in May of this year.  I had gestational diabetes 7 years ago and have suspected that my insulin never returned to normal.  I was taking Metformin 500 2x daily which was then changed to Janumet 500/50 2x daily.  I have done very well with diet and exercise and for some very strange reason, upon beginning treatment for the pituitary tumor and thyroid medicine, my blood sugars have been in range perfectly and when taking Janumet I actually experience severe low sugars, so I have stopped taking it.  My endocrinolgoist does know that I have stopped taking it.  My last A1c was 5.5. She asked that I continue testing though.  My paternal grandma also has Type 2 and high blood pressure as well as Alzhiemers now.PS. the new blood pressure medicine is lisinopril.  Seems like it's a prettty serious medication, I figured they'd start me off with something a little lower to try to control it in the beginning, especially being in childbearing years, it seems to have a lot of risk to a fetus.Thank you again for your response.Sarah

Oh, I am not sure what's going on, but today I have had a sore throat that is progressively getting worse through the day.  I am on IC amox tr-k clv 500-125 mg for my toe infection.  Can the sore throat be virus related or something to do with the Linsinopril?  I feel pretty darn lousy.

HiThanks for writing. While you are on antibiotics, the chance of viral infection remains. However flu like symptoms do occur with lisnopril. Please report this to your doctor. Either you need to modify the dose or change to another drug if your doctor determines it is due to the drug.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted.

question: Hello,I was hoping I could get some help with interperting these results.  Most came back in range, but the monocytes are LOW and the Eosinophils are HIGH.  This confuses me and my endocrinologist was a bit confused as well...I am 29 year old female, recent weight gain associated with other diagnosis... Up until the last year, have been overall very healhty.CBCWhite Blood Count 10.5  (range 3.8-10.8 Thousand/uL)Red Blood Count 4.91 (range 3.8-5.10 million/uL)Hemoglobin 14.3 (range 11.7-15.5 g/dl)Hematocrit 42.4 (range 35-45%)MCV 86.5 (range 80-100%)MCH 29.2 (range 27-33 pg)MCHC 33.8 (range 32.36 g/dL)RDW 13.2 (range 11.15%)Platelet Count 305 (range 140-400 Thousand/uL)Absolute Neutrophils 7277 (range 1500-7800 cells/uL)Absolute Lymphocytes 2594 (range 805-3900 cells/uL)Absolute Basophils 0 (range 0-200 cells/uL)Absolute Monocytes 116 L (range 200-950 cells/uL)Absolute Eosinophils 515 H (range 15-500 cells/uL)Medications and Dx:Lexapro 10 mg daily (depression/anxiety)Levothyroxine 50 mcg daily, but upgraded to 75 mcg today (Hashimoto's)Dostinex (Cabogoline) .50 mg once weekly. (Pituitary tumor, high prolactin)Please help explain these results!  If you need, I'd be happy to answer other questions or provide more lab work.Thanks in advance for your help,SarahPS. My prolactin is down to 3.4! YAY.
title: CBC help
